detaileddescription.para: Construct packet metadata from components

parameterdescription.para: see 'wickr_packet_meta' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_packet_meta' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_packet_meta' property documentation property documentation

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet metadata set owning the properties passed in

detaileddescription.para: Copy an packet metadata set

parameterdescription.para: the packet metadata set to copy

simplesect.para: a newly packet metadata set holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy packet metadata set

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the result to destroy. All properties of '*meta' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Create a key exchange from properties

parameterdescription.para: see 'wickr_key_exchange' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_key_exchange' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_key_exchange' property documentation property documentation

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet metadata set owning the properties passed in

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t *engine, const wickr_identity_chain_t *sender, const wickr_node_t *receiver, wickr_ec_key_t *packet_exchange_key, const wickr_cipher_key_t *packet_key, uint8_t version)
memberdef.name: wickr_key_exchange_create_from_components

detaileddescription.para: Compute a key exchange given sender/receiver information (Sender Encoding)
See Wickr white paper 'Prepare Key Exchange Data' for more information
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine supporting ECDH key exchanges
the identity chain of the sender
the node this key exchange is destined for

an EC key to use for the sender side of the ECDH function, the private component of this key is no longer needed after this function is called. The public component of it will get forwarded in the message header to the receiver
the cipher key to use for encrypting the payload of the message that is being created. This is the data we are protecting
the version of the packet being generated

simplesect.para: a newly allocated key exchange object holding public metadata about this exchange and the computed exchange data

detaileddescription.para: Copy a key exchange

parameterdescription.para: the key exchange to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated node holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a key exchange

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the key exchange to destroy. All properties of '*exchange' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Allocate a new key exchange array

parameterdescription.para: the number of exchanges the array should hold

simplesect.para: a newly allocated wickr_array for key exchange objects

detaileddescription.para: Set an item in a key exchange array
NOTE: Calling this function does not make a copy of 'exchange', the array simply takes ownership of it

parameterdescription.para: the array to set 'exchange' into
the location in 'array' to set exchange
the exchange to set at position 'index' in 'array'

simplesect.para: true if setting succeeds, false if the index is out of bounds

detaileddescription.para: Fetch a key exchange from an exchange array
NOTE: Calling this function does not make a copy of the exchange being returned, the array still owns it

parameterdescription.para: the array to fetch 'index' from
the index to fetch from 'array'

simplesect.para: a key exchange representing 'index' from the array

parameterdescription.para: the array to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated key exchange array that contains deep copies of the items from 'array'

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the array to destroy, all items of '*array' are also destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Create a packet header from components

parameterdescription.para: see 'wickr_packet_header' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_packet_header' property documentation property documentation

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet header owning the properties passed in

detaileddescription.para: Find a particular entry in the exchange list of a packet header

parameterdescription.para: the header to search
the node identifier of the exchange to find

simplesect.para: the key exchange for 'node_id' or NULL if it cannot be found

detaileddescription.para: Copy a packet header

parameterdescription.para: the packet header to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet header holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a packet header

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the packet header to destroy. All properties of '*header' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Serialize-Then-Encrypt a packet header
Packet headers are serialized using protocol buffers (message.pb-c.h)
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: the header to encrypt
a crypto engine capable of encryption using header_key
the key to encrypt the header with

simplesect.para: an encrypted header

detaileddescription.para: Decrypt-Then-Deserialize a packet header
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine capable of decryption using header_key
an encrypted packet header
the key to use for decryption

simplesect.para: a decrypted packet header or NULL if the decryption key is incorrect

detaileddescription.para: Create a payload from components

parameterdescription.para: see 'wickr_payload' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_payload' property documentation property documentation

simplesect.para: a newly allocated payload owning the properties passed in

detaileddescription.para: Copy a payload

parameterdescription.para: the payload to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated payload holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a payload

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the payload to destroy. All properties of '*payload' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Serialize-Then-Encrypt a payload

Payloads are serialized using protocol buffers (message.pb-c.h) NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: the payload to encrypt
a crypto engine capable of encryption using payload_key
the key to use for encryption

simplesect.para: an encrypted payload

detaileddescription.para: Decrypt-Then-Deserialize
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine capable of decryption using payload_key
an encrypted payload
the key to use for decrypting 'cipher_result'

simplesect.para: a payload or NULL if an incorrect key is provided

detaileddescription.para: Create a packet from components

parameterdescription.para: see 'wickr_protocol' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_protocol' property documentation property documentation
see 'wickr_protocol' property documentation property documentation

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet owning the properties passed in

detaileddescription.para: Parse a packet from a buffer generated by 'wickr_packet_serialize'

parameterdescription.para: a buffer output from 'wickr_packet_serialize'

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet using parsed data from 'buffer' or NULL if parsing fails

detaileddescription.para: Serialize a packet to a buffer

parameterdescription.para: the packet to serialize

simplesect.para: a buffer representing the packet in the following format: | VERSION (4BITS) SIGNATURE_CURVE_ID (4BITS) | CONTENT | SIGNATURE OF CONTENT |

detaileddescription.para: Copy a packet

parameterdescription.para: the packet to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated packet holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a packet

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the packet to destroy. All properties of '*packet' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Create a negative parse result due to a failure

parameterdescription.para: status of packet signature validation
error message related to parsing the packet

simplesect.para: a parse result containing the provided status information and NULL properties

detaileddescription.para: Create a positive parse result

parameterdescription.para: the parsed header information
discovered key exchange for a particular requested node, or NULL if no node was specified
the encrypted payload parsed from the message

simplesect.para: a parse result containing the provided information and non-error codes for 'signature_status' and 'err'

detaileddescription.para: Copy a parse result

parameterdescription.para: the parse result to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated parse result holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a parse result

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the parse result to destroy. All properties of '*result' will also be destroyed

detaileddescription.para: Create a negative decode result

parameterdescription.para: the error found during decoding

simplesect.para: a newly allocated decode result with error 'decode_error' and NULL for other properties

detaileddescription.para: Create a positive decode result

parameterdescription.para: the decrypted payload found during decoding
the payload key derived during decoding

simplesect.para: a newly allocated decode result with no error

detaileddescription.para: Copy a decode result

parameterdescription.para: the decode result to copy

simplesect.para: a newly allocated decode result holding a deep copy of the properties of 'source'

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a decode result

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the decode result to destroy. All properties of '*result' will also be destroyed

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t *engine, const wickr_cipher_key_t *header_key, const wickr_cipher_key_t *payload_key, wickr_ec_key_t *exchange_key, const wickr_payload_t *payload, const wickr_node_array_t *recipients, const wickr_identity_chain_t *sender_signing_identity)
memberdef.name: wickr_packet_create_from_components

detaileddescription.para: Generate a packet given components
For more information see Wickr white paper (Sending a Message)
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine capable of ECDH and signing operations using exchange_key, and cipher operations using payload_key
the key to encrypt the header of the message with
the key to encrypt the payload of the message with
the key to use as the local key exchange keypair, the public side of this key will wind up in the resulting packet header
the plaintext payload to encrypt and bundle into the packet
the array of nodes that the
the identity chain belonging to the creator of the packet

simplesect.para: a 'sender_signing_identity' signed packet containing encrypted payload 'payload, and header containing key exchanges for 'recipients'

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_crypto_engine_t *engine, const wickr_packet_t *packet, const wickr_buffer_t *receiver_node_id, wickr_header_keygen_func header_keygen_func, const wickr_identity_chain_t *sender_signing_identity)
memberdef.name: wickr_parse_result_from_packet

detaileddescription.para: Parse a received packet and validate it's signature
For more information see Wickr white paper (Receiving a Message 1-5)
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: a crypto engine
the packet to parse

node_id of the recipient. If set, parsing will fail if a node_id labeled key exchange is not found in the decoded header's key exchange list. If not set, the resulting parse result will contain NULL for the key exchange and simply return all other properties
a function that can generate a header key for this packet
the sender of the packet

simplesect.para: a parse result containing a successful or unsuccessful error and signature status

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_packet_t *packet, const wickr_crypto_engine_t *engine, const wickr_parse_result_t *parse_result, wickr_buffer_t *receiver_dev_id, wickr_ec_key_t *receiver_decode_key, wickr_identity_chain_t *receiver_signing_identity, const wickr_identity_chain_t *sender_signing_identity)
memberdef.name: wickr_decode_result_from_parse_result

detaileddescription.para: Decode a parsed packet payload using a fetched ephemeral decode_key
For more information see Wickr white paper (Receiving a Message 6-9)
NOTE: This is a low level function that should not be called directly from this API if it can be avoided. Please use the 'wickr_ctx' API instead since it is a higher level and safer set of functions

parameterdescription.para: the packet to decode
a crypto engine
a previously generated parse result from 'packet'
the 'msg_proto_id' of 'wickr_dev_info' of the recipient
the key to attempt to complete the key exchange for discovered in the parse phase, so that the payload can be decoded
the recipient of the packet
the sender of the packet used

simplesect.para: a decode result containing decrypted packet information if decode succeeded

detaileddescription.para: The oldest packet version supported is version 2
The most recent version of the protocol is version 3
